attributes.action: All elected representatives to work together for the good of the country
attributes.additional_details: We voted these people in to look after our best interests, we pay them a substantial amount of money, plus expenses, and all they seem to be doing is looking out for themselves. MPs could have ends this Brexit fiasco months ago by working together with other parties for the good of the country.
attributes.background:
All of our MPs should work together for the good of the country, instead of scoring cheap points to further their own political agenda.
A prime and example of this is Jeremy Corbyn urging labour Mps to abstain from the vote on a second referendum and instead pushing for a general election instead.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because how individual MPs approach Brexit is a decision for them and not the UK Government and Parliament as a whole.

If you would like the Government to try and form a government of national unity you could sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/246772
